From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /aktiˈbaɾ/ [ak.t̪iˈβ̞aɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: ac‧ti‧var

Verb

[edit]

activar (first-person singular indicative present activo, past participle activáu)

  1. to activate (to make something active)
  2. to enable (to activate a function of an electronic or mechanical device)

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of activar
infinitive activar
gerund activando
past participle m activáu, f activada, n activao, m pl activaos, f pl activaes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present activo actives activa activamos activáis activen
imperfect activaba activabes activaba activábemos, activábamos activabeis, activabais activaben
preterite activé activasti, activesti activó activemos activastis, activestis activaron
pluperfect activare, activara activares, activaras activare, activara activáremos, activáramos activareis, activarais activaren, activaran
future activaré activarás activará activaremos activaréis activarán
conditional activaría activaríes activaría activaríemos, activaríamos activaríeis, activaríais activaríen
subjunctive present active actives, activas active activemos activéis activen, activan
imperfect activare, activara activares, activaras activare, activara activáremos, activáramos activareis, activarais activaren, activaran
imperative — activa — — activái —

Related terms

[edit]
  • actividá

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin āctīvus.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [ək.tiˈβa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [ək.tiˈva]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [ak.tiˈvaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

activar (first-person singular present activo, first-person singular preterite activí, past participle activat)

  1. to activate (to make something active)
    Antonym: desactivar
  2. to enable (to activate a function of an electronic or mechanical device)
    Antonym: desactivar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of activar (first conjugation)
infinitive activar
gerund activant
past participle masculine feminine
singular activat activada
plural activats activades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present activo actives activa activem activeu activen
imperfect activava activaves activava activàvem activàveu activaven
future activaré activaràs activarà activarem activareu activaran
preterite activí activares activà activàrem activàreu activaren
conditional activaria activaries activaria activaríem activaríeu activarien

affirmative — activa activi activem activeu activin
negative (no) — no activis no activi no activem no activeu no activin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • activació
  • desactivar

Further reading

[edit]
  • “activar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “activar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “activar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “activar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

activar (first-person singular present activo, first-person singular preterite activei, past participle activado)

  1. (transitive) to activate (to encourage development or induce increased activity; to stimulate)
  2. (transitive) to activate, to enable (to put a mechanism, device or system into action or motion)
    Antonym: desactivar
  3. (transitive, chemistry, physics) to activate (to render more reactive)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of activar
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(ti) 		Third-person
(el / ela / Vde.) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / Vdes.)
Infinitive
Impersonal activar
Personal activar activares activar activarmos activardes activaren
Gerund
activando
Past participle
Masculine activado activados
Feminine activada activadas
Indicative
Present activo activas activa activamos activades activan
Imperfect activaba activabas activaba activabamos activabades activaban
Preterite activei activaches activou activamos activastes activaron
Pluperfect activara activaras activara activaramos activarades activaran
Future activarei activarás activará activaremos activaredes activarán
Conditional activaría activarías activaría activariamos activariades activarían
Subjunctive
Present active actives active activemos activedes activen
Imperfect activase activases activase activásemos activásedes activasen
Future activar activares activar activarmos activardes activaren
Imperative
Affirmative activa active activemos activade activen
Negative (non) non actives non active non activemos non activedes non activen

Derived terms

[edit]
  • activación
  • desactivar

Related terms

[edit]
  • activo

Further reading

[edit]
  • “activar”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025

Verb

activar

Portuguese

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

activar (first-person singular present activo, first-person singular preterite activei, past participle activado)

  1. pre-reform spelling (used until 1943 in Brazil and 1990 in Portugal) of ativar; still used where the agreement hasn’t come into effect and may occur as a sporadic misspelling

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of activar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / vocês)
Infinitive
Impersonal activar
Personal activar activares activar activarmos activardes activarem
Gerund
activando
Past participle
Masculine activado activados
Feminine activada activadas
Indicative
Present activo activas activa activamos activais activam
Imperfect activava activavas activava activávamos activáveis activavam
Preterite activei activaste activou activamos1, activámos2 activastes activaram
Pluperfect activara activaras activara activáramos activáreis activaram
Future activarei activarás activará activaremos activareis activarão
Conditional activaria activarias activaria activaríamos activaríeis activariam
Subjunctive
Present active actives active activemos activeis activem
Imperfect activasse activasses activasse activássemos activásseis activassem
Future activar activares activar activarmos activardes activarem
Imperative
Affirmative activa active activemos activai activem
Negative (não) não actives não active não activemos não activeis não activem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • activação
  • actividade
  • activismo
  • activo

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From activo (“active”), from Latin actīvus.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /aɡtiˈbaɾ/ [aɣ̞.t̪iˈβ̞aɾ]
  • Audio (Venezuela):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: ac‧ti‧var

Verb

[edit]

activar (first-person singular present activo, first-person singular preterite activé, past participle activado)

  1. (transitive) to activate (to encourage development or induce increased activity; to stimulate)
  2. (transitive) to activate, to enable (to put a mechanism, device or system into action or motion)
    Synonym: habilitar
    Antonym: desactivar
  3. (transitive, chemistry, physics) to activate (to render more reactive)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of activar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive activar
gerund activando
past participle masculine feminine
singular activado activada
plural activados activadas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
indicative yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

    Selected combined forms of activar

These forms are generated automatically and may not actually be used. Pronoun usage varies by region.

with formal second-person plural imperative activen dative actívenme not used actívenle actívennos not used actívenles, actívense
